intro: Harpalyce foliosa, commonly known as the leafy harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its seed pods are slender and often persist on the plant after flowering. Harpalyce foliosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
